body_html:
Hi @martinwicke I didn't build TF from source, installed via pip install on mac osx, on python3.
I have the same error running the bazel commands on python3.

I see that it's complaining about running import tensorflow while in the tensorflow directory. I'm not very experienced with bazel, so I assumed I'm supposed to be running the bazel commands from the tensorflow directory.

Could you give me some hint about this? would like to close this out ~

I have the same error running the bazel commands on python3.
I see that it's complaining about running import tensorflow while in the tensorflow directory. I'm not very experienced with bazel, so I assumed I'm supposed to be running the bazel commands from the tensorflow directory.

body:
Hi @martinwicke  I didn't build TF from source, installed via `pip install` on mac osx, on python3. 
I have the same error running the bazel commands on python3. 

I see that it's complaining about running `import tensorflow` while in the tensorflow directory. I'm not very experienced with bazel, so I assumed I'm supposed to be running the bazel commands from the tensorflow directory. 

Could you give me some hint about this? would like to close this out ~
